hints.content:
Squirrel| Number of [[☃ image 1]] | Number of acorns eaten
:- | :-: | :-:
Nutsy| $5$ | $\blueD3  \times 5= {15}$  
Stripe | $3$ | $\blueD3  \times 3 = {\greenD9}$
Fluffy| $4$ | $\blueD3  \times 4= {12}$  
Scamper | $6$ | $\blueD3 \times 6= \maroonD{18}$

Scamper ate the most acorns $(\maroonD{18})$.

Stripe ate the fewest acorns $(\greenD {9})$.

$\maroonD{18} - \greenD{9} = 9$
The squirrel with the most acorns ate $9$ more than the squirrel with the fewest acorns.

question.content:
Naama graphed how many acorns the squirrels at the nature center ate.  


[[☃ image 1]]

[[☃ image 2]]

**How many more acorns did the squirrel with the most acorns eat than the squirrel with the fewest acorns?**   
  
[[☃ input-number 2]]   acorns

options.alt: A picture of an acorn equals 3 acorns.

A picture graph shows the horizontal axis labeled Squirrel and the vertical axis labeled Acorns. Each squirrel is listed along the horizontal axis from left to right as follows: Nutsy, Stripe, Fluffy, and Scamper. The number of acorns for each squirrel is represented by the number of pictures of acorns plotted on the graph. Nutsy is represented by 5 pictures of acorns, Stripe is represented by 3 pictures of acorns, Fluffy is represented by 4 pictures of acorns, and Scamper is represented by 6 pictures of acorns.
